body.name: Crumbs
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews Review “An enthralling new world brimming with magic.” — Kirkus Reviews“This story is the perfect amount of sweet…enchanting and picturesque. It has the perfect combo of fantasy, realism, and romance.” — School Library Journal"This is a sweet love story, and readers will want to get cozy and grab a hot tea to go with this delicious slice of romance as the two leads find their way to each other." — Bulletin of the Center for Children’s Books“The art and colors are as soft as the story is sweet, and the denouement is a refreshing twist on a common trope. Perfect for tweens and teens who like romance comics.” — Booklist About the Author Danie Stirling is the creator of fantasy webcomics, Crumbs and Small Blessings. They’re fascinated by shiny things, and can sometimes be observed leaving their cave in the company of a pair of small wizardly dogs. Twitter and Instagram: @Whitherling

body.description: An IndieBound BestsellerFalling in love just got sweeter in this charming, romantic YA graphic novel from WEBTOON, the #1 digital comic platform. Ray, a young seer struggling with her powers, discovers first love and friendship in her town's magic bakery.In a very special town, there’s an even more unusual bakery with a selection of baked treats hand-crafted to help your dreams come true. For Ray, a quiet young woman with special powers of her own, the order is always the same: a hot tea with a delicious side of romance.When Ray meets Laurie, the kind barista who aspires to be a professional musician, she gets a real taste of love for the first time. But even with a spark of magic, romance isn’t so simple. Both Ray and Laurie are chasing their own dreams and even when Ray starts to see the future, she can’t predict her fate with Laurie.Based on the beloved webcomic from WEBTOON, this sweet coming-of-age story of friendship and first love comes to life in graphic novel format with gorgeous illustrations and exclusive content.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite story!!!
reviews.reviewText: Crumbs has beautiful art and such a heart warming story. I had to get a physical copy of this amazing WebToon. Highly recommend!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely adored the series on webtoonz so I knew I needed the physical copy! The art style and writing is great and the colors are super vibrant. I was worried that only the first season would be in the book but nope! Both of the seasons are on the book! I can't wait to read the story again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Crumbs was amazing and cute at the same time. It did slow down in the middle so I had to stop reading then pick it up over and over. Finally got to the end and I was so warm inside!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great story. I love the art style.
reviews.reviewText: It is a sweet love story and I am excited to see the next chapters printed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute when it’s supposed to be, deep when it mattered
reviews.reviewText: Beautiful artwork, and I liked the character problems. Laurie’s people pleasing issue is not something we get to see often so I really liked that

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Delightful coming of age story
reviews.reviewText: Ray is a seer, focused on becoming a member of the Council of Sorcerers. She regularly goes to the local bakery for a treat and a break from studying. There she sees the bakery owner’s nephew, Laurie and as she gets to know him and his friends she begins to wonder where her future truly lies.This is a lovely YA coming of age story showing us all the aspects of friendship, young love and learning to be true to yourself. The artwork is delightful and the characters are a diverse group. Recommended

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful artwork, plot and character development could've been better
reviews.reviewText: WARNING: I'll be getting into a few details about the storyline so if you'd rather not know anything about details here is my TLDR: Cute art but the plot and character development are lacking. It is good to be viewed as a light read to pass the time with some very cute visuals.I bought this book mainly because I loved the art style and that did not disappoint me. Very vibrant and cutesy. The storyline was ok but it left much to be desired. It seemed to focus on the intricacies of Ray's career — going deep into her visions careerwise and it just didn't amount to that much in the bigger picture. And what was up with the memory erasure? Why wasn't more explained about that? Laurie's aunt doesn't even know why she left her career that she was clearly the most talented in. Why isn't anyone even remotely concerned that their government has this kind of power? Not to make a cute book sinister but any government that has the power to erase your memory if you leave your career should at the very least be questioned. I thought there would be a bigger revelation Ray would come to realize about that career path possibly not being all that great but there were never any solid answers. I also thought Ray and Laurie's relationship happened too soon and had little to go off of. They talked very little about their lives outside of their aspirations. It seems that ultimately the author wanted to say a lot but just couldn't connect the dots cohesively. Even with all that being said, the book is worth the look as a fun, easy read with great inclusion of BIPOC characters as long as you can manage your expectations.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars CUTEST BOOK IN THE WORLD!!!! Read it all in one sitting!
reviews.reviewText: It's such a cute romantic comic that you won't wanna put it down
I loved the webtoon and had to get a physical copy!
